content.body: keithamus: I have a GitHub question. I was curious who downvoted an a11y PR question, but their profile page 404s. But I thought that if someone deleted their profile they'd be known as "ghost" or some such. Do you know what might be going on?

content.body: Probably spammy if their profile 404s. Perhaps reactions don't get cleaned up like comments do :/

content.body: Community update: Ada rust crate v3.1.0 is available with URLSearchParams. https://github.com/ada-url/rust/releases/tag/v3.1.0
TIL about ada-url rust. Looks like a cool target for differential fuzzing w/ rust-url :>
* TIL about ada-url rust. Looks like a cool target for differential fuzzing with servo/rust-url :>

content.body:
> <@fbraun:mozilla.org> TIL about ada-url rust. Looks like a cool target for differential fuzzing with servo/rust-url :>

I guess servo/rust-url needs to be spec compliant first. https://github.com/servo/rust-url/blob/main/url/tests/expected_failures.txt
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @fbraun:mozilla.org
TIL about ada-url rust. Looks like a cool target for differential fuzzing with servo/rust-url :>
I guess servo/rust-url needs to be spec compliant first. https://github.com/servo/rust-url/blob/main/url/tests/expected_failures.txt

content.body: Yagiz Nizipli: nice, are you watching whatwg/url? I expect we'll make some changes next year around file: URLs in particular. And then hopefully not too long after we can consider parsing fully stabilized.
